Player History
Had first career hit (double) on 4/3/1966, off Dick Selma (PHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/22/1966, off Jim Lonborg (CHC)...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1969...
Injured on 7/14/1970 with a Strained Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Traded from New York (N) to Philadelphia on 1/31/1971 (Going to PHI: P J. Bibby, 3B B. Browne, P B. Veale. Going to NYM: P D. Siebler)...
Traded from Philadelphia to Cleveland on 5/14/1971 (Going to PHI: P J. Lamb. Going to CLE: 3B B. Browne)...
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 4/18/1977 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 4/27/1977 with a Strained Rib Cage Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 6/4/1977 with a Strained Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 9/3/1977 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 5 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by New York (N) on 2/4/1978 to a 1-year deal worth $600,000 per year...
